thread.title: Arsenal FC news: Mesut Ozil suffering crisis of confidence days before Champions League clash, admits Arsene Wenger | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal FC news: Mesut Ozil suffering crisis of confidence days before Champions League clash, admits Arsene Wenger | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal FC news: Mesut Ozil suffering crisis of confidence days before Champions League clash, admits Arsene Wenger | Metro News
text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 11:00 pm Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil has struggled in recent week (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil is suffering from a lack of confidence after failing to score in eight straight games, Arsene Wenger has admitted. 
The German star has cut a frustrated figure in recent weeks, struggling to make an impact for the Gunners who have slipped 10 points adrift of Chelsea. 
Ozil, 28, has not scored for the north London side since December and Wenger admits he is concerned by his form. 
‘I felt he was not completely confident technically [against Hull],’ said Wenger. 
‘I completely agree, that’s a problem because you always think he can deliver something special. 
‘It’s true that technically he did things that he is not used to doing. I don’t know why, it can happen. Arsene Wenger has demanded more from the German playmaker (Picture: Getty) Arsenal fixtures 
Bayern Munich – Champions League (A) – Wed 15 Feb Sutton – FA Cup (A) – weekend of 17/18 Feb Liverpool (A) – Sat 4 Mar Bayern Munich – Champions League (H) – Tue 7 Mar Leicester (H) – Sat 11 Mar West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar Manchester City (H) – Sat 1 Apr West Ham (H) – Tue 4 Apr 
‘I can’t think of a specific reason. I had a chat with him on Friday. He seemed all right.
